Sudoku Solvers for Multiple Variants

Sudoku has many different variant types involving chess moves and I decided to write solvers that will solve the puzzle based upon the given constraints. If there is more than one solution, the solver will find it!

Skills Utilized:

  • Recursive Solvers
  • C++
  • Python
  • MATLAB
 Click here to check out the Code!

Logic Heavy Approach

Previously, I have written a script to find a solution to Classic Sudoku puzzles by using a method similar to how a human would solve it. This algorithm relied heavily on logic to place all the values in each of the puzzle's 81 tiles. The algorithm can be broken down into two parts. The first part would determine all possible values for a specific tile (x,y). If there is only a single solution to the tile, it would place the answer into the box. The second algorithm determines if a row, column, or box only has one missing value then places the value into the tile. The combination of these algorithms allows for the program to solve classic puzzles of most difficulties.

Solution to the Logic Heavy Approach on a HaB

Recursive Approach

The recursive approach utilizes backtracking to guess and check solutions into the tiles until a valid solution is found. The approach checks the box, column, and row constraints for possible values and then selects the first value. The algorithm continues moving through the 81 tiles. If the algorithm gets stuck, the program will backtrack and try the next possible value. This method allowed for the code to solve any level of Sudoku puzzle in very quick times. Additionally, the program will also output all possible solutions allowing the user to determine if a unique solution exists for the puzzle.

Additional Variants

Anti-King's Move

Anti-King's Move infuses chess and sudoku. This variant adds a constraint where all the digits (1-9) can not be a king's move away from each other. With all the classic sudoku constraints, the only tiles added to the constraint are the ones which are a single diagonal tile away.

Anti-Queen's Move

Anti-Queen's Move is very similar to Anti-King's Move but adds the diagonal constraint for all tiles diagonal to the tile in question. This constraint is only active on a single digit (usually on the value 9). If this constraint was active for all values, the puzzle would be infeasible and therefore no solution would be found.

Anti-Knight's Move

Anti-Knight's Move adds the constraint to each number similar to a Knight in chess, where the knight moves in an L shape. This constraint is active for all numbers and provides one of my favorite variants of Sudoku.

Format for the Chess Variants.
Orange - Anti-Queen | Red - Anti-King | Green - Anti-Knight

Results

A robust Sudoku solver for the Classic, Anti-King's Move, Anti-Queen's move, and Anti-Knight's move variants which runs within a reasonable time. These were tested on multiple puzzles and the outputs were correct for each programming language. For more information on how to run the script(s), please check out the ReadMe in the project files on GitHub linked above./p>
